title: The One Where Monica Gets a New Roomate (The Pilot-The Uncut Version)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: There's nothing to tell! He's just some guy I work with!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: C'mon, you're going out with the guy! There's gotta be something wrong with him!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right Joey, be nice. So does he have a hump? A hump and a hairpiece?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait, does he eat chalk?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Just, 'cause, I don't want her to go through what I went through with Carl- oh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, everybody relax. This is not even a date. It's just two people going out to dinner and- not having sex.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Sounds like a date to me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright, so I'm back in high school, I'm standing in the middle of the cafeteria, and I realize I am totally naked.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. Had that dream.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Then I look down, and I realize there's a phone... there.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Instead of...?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's right.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Never had that dream.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All of a sudden, the phone starts to ring. Now I don't know what to do, everybody starts looking at me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And they weren't looking at you before?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Finally, I figure I'd better answer it, a nd it turns out it's my mother, which is very-very weird, because- she never calls me!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (mortified) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: This guy says hello, I wanna kill myself.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you okay, sweetie?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I just feel like someone reached down my throat, grabbed my small intestine, pulled it out of my mouth and tied it around my neck...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Cookie?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (explaining to the others) Carol moved her stuff out today.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ohh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Let me get you some coffee.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh! Oh! (She starts to pluck at the air just in front of Ross.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, no don't! Stop cleansing my aura! No, just leave my aura alone, okay?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Fine! Be murky!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'll be fine, alright? Really, everyone. I hope she'll be very happy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No you don't.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No I don't, to hell with her, she left me!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And you never knew she was a lesbian...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No!! Okay?! Why does everyone keep fixating on that? She didn't know, how should I know?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Sometimes I wish I was a lesbian... (They all stare at him.) Did I say that out loud?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I told mom and dad last night, they seemed to take it pretty well.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh really, so that hysterical phone call I got from a woman at sobbing 3:00 A.M., "I'll never have grandchildren, I'll never have grandchildren." was what? A wrong number?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Alright Ross, look. You're feeling a lot of pain right now. You're angry. You're hurting. Can I tell you what the answer is?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Strip joint! C'mon, you're single! Have some hormones!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don't want to be single, okay? I just... I just- I just wanna be married again!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And I just want a million dollars! (He extends his hand hopefully.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God Monica hi! Thank God! I just went to your building and you weren't there and then this guy with a big hammer said you might be here and you are, you are!

dialogue.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogue.text: Can I get you some coffee?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (pointing at Rachel) De-caff. (to All) Okay, everybody, this is Rachel, another Lincoln High survivor. (to Rachel) This is everybody, this is Chandler, and Phoebe, and Joey, and- you remember my brother Ross?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi, sure!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So you wanna tell us now, or are we waiting for four wet bridesmaids?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God... well, it started about a half hour before the wedding. I was in the room where we were keeping all the presents, and I was looking at this gravy boat. This really gorgeous Lamauge gravy boat. When all of a sudden- (to the waitress that brought her coffee)Sweet 'n' Lo?- I realized that I was more turned on by this gravy boat than by Barry! And then I got really freaked out,

dialogue.speaker:
AND THAT'S WHEN IT
HIT ME
dialogue.text: how much Barry looks like Mr. Potato Head. Y'know, I mean, I always knew looked familiar, but... Anyway, I just had to get out of there, and I started wondering 'Why am I doing this, and who am I doing this for?'. (to Monica) So anyway I just didn't know where to go, and I know that you and I have kinda drifted apart, but you're the only person I knew who lived here in the city.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Who wasn't invited to the wedding.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ooh, I was kinda hoping that wouldn't be an issue... [

dialogue.speaker: SCENE
dialogue.text: Monica's Apartment, everyone is there and watching a Spanish Soap on TV and are trying to figure out what is going on.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Now I'm guessing that he bought her the big pipe organ, and she's really not happy about it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (imitating the characters) Tuna or egg salad? Decide!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (in a deep voice) I'll have whatever Christine is having.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (on phone) Daddy, I just... I can't marry him! I'm sorry. I just don't love him. Well, it matters to me!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: If I let go of my hair, my head will fall off.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (re TV) Ooh, she should not be wearing those pants.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I say push her down the stairs.

dialogue.speaker: AND JOEY
dialogue.text: Push her down the stairs! Push her down the stairs! Push her down the stairs!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: C'mon Daddy, listen to me! It's like, it's like, all of my life, everyone has always told me, 'You're a shoe! You're a shoe, you're a shoe, you're a shoe!'. And today I just stopped and I said, 'What if I don't wanna be a shoe? What if I wanna be a- a purse, y'know? Or a- or a hat! No, I'm not saying I want you to buy me a hat, I'm saying I am a ha- It's a metaphor, Daddy!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You can see where he'd have trouble.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look Daddy, it's my life. Well maybe I'll just stay here with Monica.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, I guess we've established who's staying here with Monica...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, maybe that's my decision. Well, maybe I don't need your money. Wait!! Wait, I said maybe!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Just breathe, breathe.. that's it. Just try to think of nice calm things...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (sings) Raindrops on roses and rabbits and kittens, (Rachel and Monica turn to look at her.) bluebells and sleighbells and- something with mittens... La la la la... something and noodles with string. These are a few...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm all better now.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (grins and walks to the kitchen and says to Chandler and Joey.) I helped!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, look, this is probably for the best, y'know? Independence. Taking control of your life. The whole, 'hat' thing.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (comforting her) And hey, you need anything, you can always come to Joey. Me and Chandler live across the hall. And he's away a lot.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, stop hitting on her! It's her wedding day!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What, like there's a rule or something?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Please don't do that again, it's a horrible sound.

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: (over the intercom) It's, uh, it's Paul.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh God, is it 6:30? Buzz him in!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Who's Paul?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Paul the Wine Guy, Paul?

dialogue.speaker: MAYBE. JOEY
dialogue.text: Wait. Your 'not a real date' tonight is with Paul the Wine Guy?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He finally asked you out?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh, this is a Dear Diary moment.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rach, wait, I can cancel...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Please, no, go, that'd be fine!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Are, are you okay? I mean, do you want me to stay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (choked voice) That'd be good...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (horrified) Really?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (normal voice) No, go on! It's Paul the Wine Guy!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What does that mean? Does he sell it, drink it, or just complain a lot? (Chandler doesn't know.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi, come in! Paul, this is.. (They are all lined up next to the door.)... everybody, everybody, this is Paul.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey! Paul! Hi! The Wine Guy! Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I didn't catch your name. Paul, was it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, umm-umm, I'll just--I'll be right back, I just gotta go ah, go ah...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: A wandering?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Change! Okay, sit down. (Shows Paul in) Two seconds.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh, I just pulled out four eyelashes. That can't be good.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Paul!

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Here's a little tip, she really likes it when you rub her neck in the same spot over and over and over again until it starts to get a little red.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (yelling from the bedroom) Shut up, Joey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So Rachel, what're you, uh... what're you up to tonight?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I was kinda supposed to be headed for Aruba on my honeymoon, so nothing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Right, you're not even getting your honeymoon, God.. No, no, although, Aruba, this time of year... talk about your- (thinks) -big lizards... Anyway, if you don't feel like being alone tonight, Joey and Chandler are coming over to help me put together my new furniture.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (deadpan) Yes, and we're very excited about it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well actually thanks, but I think I'm just gonna hang out here tonight. It's been kinda a long day.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, sure.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey Pheebs, you wanna help?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I wish I could, but I don't want to.

subjects:
AND THAT'S WHEN IT
HIT ME

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Subway, Phoebe is singing for
change.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (singing) Love is sweet as summer showers, love is a wondrous work of art, but your love oh your love, your love...is like a giant pigeon...crapping on my heart. La-la-la-la-la- (some guy gives her some change and to that guy) Thank you. (sings) La-la-la-la...ohhh!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: The Subway, Phoebe is singing for
change.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross's Apartment, the guys are there assembling
furniture.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (squatting and reading the instructions) I'm supposed to attach a brackety thing to the side things, using a bunch of these little worm guys. I have no brackety thing, I see no whim guys whatsoever and- I cannot feel my legs.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm thinking we've got a bookcase here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It's a beautiful thing.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (picking up a leftover part) What's this?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I would have to say that is an 'L'-shaped bracket.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Which goes where?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I have no idea.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Done with the bookcase!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All finished!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (clutching a beer can and sniffing) This was Carol's favorite beer. She always drank it out of the can, I should have known.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey-hey-hey-hey, if you're gonna start with that stuff we're outta here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, please don't spoil all this fun.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ross, let me ask you a question. She got the furniture, the stereo, the good TV- what did you get?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You guys.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, God.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You got screwed.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Ross's Apartment, the guys are there assembling
furniture.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Paul are eating.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: I know, I know, I'm such an idiot. I guess I should have caught on when she started going to the dentist four and five times a week. I mean, how clean can teeth get?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: My brother's going through that right now, he's such a mess. How did you get through it?

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Well, you might try accidentally breaking something valuable of hers, say her-

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: -leg?

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: (laughing) That's one way! Me, I- I went for the watch.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You actually broke her watch? Wow! The worst thing I ever did was, I-I shredded by boyfriend's favorite bath towel.

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Ooh, steer clear of you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's right. [

dialogue.speaker: SCENE
dialogue.text: Monica's Apartment, Rachel is talking on the phone and pacing.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Barry, I'm sorry... I am so sorry... I know you probably think that this is all about what I said the other day about you making love with your socks on, but it isn't... it isn't, it's about me, and I ju- (She stops talking and dials the phone.) Hi, machine cut me off again... anyway... look, look, I know that some girl is going to be incredibly lucky to become Mrs. Barry Finkel, but it isn't me, it's not me. And not that I have any idea who me is right now, but you just have to give me a chance too... (The maching cuts her off again and she redials.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Paul are eating.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross's Apartment; Ross is pacing while Joey and
Chandler are working on some more furniture.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm divorced! I'm only 26 and I'm divorced!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Shut up!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You must stop! (Chandler hits what he is working on with a hammer and it collapses.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That only took me an hour.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look, Ross, you gotta understand, between us we haven't had a relationship that has lasted longer than a Mento. You , however have had the love of a woman for four years. Four years of closeness and sharing at the end of which she ripped your heart out, and that is why we don't do it! I don't think that was my point!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You know what the scariest part is? What if there's only one woman for everybody, y'know? I mean what if you get one woman- and that's it? Unfortunately in my case, there was only one woman- for her...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? 'One woman'? That's like saying there's only one flavor of ice cream for you. Lemme tell you something, Ross. There's lots of flavors out there. There's Rocky Road, and Cookie Dough, and Bing! Cherry Vanilla. You could get 'em with Jimmies, or nuts, or whipped cream! This is the best thing that ever happened to you! You got married, you were, like, what, eight? Welcome back to the world! Grab a spoon!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I honestly don't know if I'm hungry or horny.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Stay out of my freezer! [

dialogue.speaker: SCENE
dialogue.text: A Restaurant, Monica and Paul are still eating.]

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Ever since she walked out on me, I, uh...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?..... What, you wanna spell it out with noodles?

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: No, it's, it's more of a fifth date kinda revelation.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, so there is gonna be a fifth date?

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Isn't there?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah... yeah, I think there is. -What were you gonna say?

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Well, ever-ev-... ever since she left me, um, I haven't been able to, uh, perform. (Monica takes a sip of her drink.) ...Sexually.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (spitting out her drink in shock) Oh God, oh God, I am sorry... I am so sorry...

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: It's okay...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know being spit on is probably not what you need right now. Um... how long?

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Two years.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow! I'm-I'm-I'm glad you smashed her watch!

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: So you still think you, um... might want that fifth date?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (pause)...Yeah. Yeah, I do.

scenes.location:
Ross's Apartment; Ross is pacing while Joey and
Chandler are working on some more furniture.
scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Ross's Apartment; Ross is pacing while Joey and
Chandler are working on some more furniture.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica's Apartment, Rachel is watching Joanne
Loves Chaci .]

dialogue.speaker: PRIEST ON TV
dialogue.text: We are gathered here today to join Joanne Louise Cunningham and Charles, Chachi-Chachi-Chachi, Arcola in the bound of holy matrimony.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh...see... but Joanne loved Chachi! That's the difference!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica's Apartment, Rachel is watching Joanne
Loves Chaci .]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Ross's Apartment, they're all sitting around and
talking.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (scornful) Grab a spoon. Do you know how long it's been since I've grabbed a spoon? Do the words 'Billy, don't be a hero' mean anything to you?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Great story! But, I uh, I gotta go, I got a date with Andrea--Angela--Andrea... Oh man, (looks to Chandler)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Angela's the screamer, Andrea has cats.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Right. Thanks. It's June. I'm outta here. (Exits.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Y'know, here's the thing. Even if I could get it together enough to- to ask a woman out,... who am I gonna ask? (He gazes out of the window.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Ross's Apartment, they're all sitting around and
talking.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica's Apartment, Rachel is making coffee for
Joey and Chandler.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Isn't this amazing? I mean, I have never made coffee before in my entire life.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That is amazing.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Congratulations.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know, I figure if I can make coffee, there isn't anything I can't do.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: If can invade Poland, there isn't anything I can't do.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Listen, while you're on a roll, if you feel like you gotta make like a Western omelet or something... (Joey and Chandler taste the coffee, grimace, and pour it into a plant pot.) Although actually I'm really not that hungry...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering, to herself) Oh good, Lenny and Squigy are here.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Morning. Good morning.

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: (entering from Monica's room) Morning.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Morning, Paul.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello, Paul.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi, Paul, is it?

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Thank you! Thank you so much!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Stop!

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: No, I'm telling you last night was like umm, all my birthdays, both graduations, plus the barn raising scene in Witness .

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We'll talk later.

dialogue.speaker: PAUL
dialogue.text: Yeah. (They kiss) Thank you. (Exits)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That wasn't a real date?! What the hell do you do on a real date?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Shut up, and put my table back.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Okayyy! (They do so.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right, kids, I gotta get to work. If I don't input those numbers,... it doesn't make much of a difference...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So, like, you guys all have jobs?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, we all have jobs. See, that's how we buy stuff.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, I'm an actor.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow! Would I have seen you in anything?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I doubt it. Mostly regional work.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh wait, wait, unless you happened to catch the Reruns' production of Pinocchio , at the little theater in the park.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, it was a job all right?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: 'Look, Gippetto, I'm a real live boy.'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I will not take this abuse. (Walks to the door and opens it to leave.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're right, I'm sorry. (Burst into song and dances out of the door.) " Once I was a wooden boy, a little wooden boy... "

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You should both know, that he's a dead man. Oh, Chandler? (Starts after Chandler.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So how you doing today? Did you sleep okay? Talk to Barry? I can't stop smiling.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I can see that. You look like you slept with a hanger in your mouth.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know, he's just so, so... Do you remember you and Tony DeMarco?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, it's like that. With feelings.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh wow. Are you in trouble.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Big time!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Want a wedding dress? Hardly used.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think we are getting a little ahead of selves here. Okay. Okay. I am just going to get up, go to work and not think about him all day. Or else I'm just gonna get up and go to work.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, look, wish me luck!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What for?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm gonna go get one of those (Thinks) job things.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica's Apartment, Rachel is making coffee for
Joey and Chandler.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Iridium, Monica is working as Frannie enters.]

dialogue.speaker: FRANNIE
dialogue.text: Hey, Monica!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey Frannie, welcome back! How was Florida?

dialogue.speaker: FRANNIE
dialogue.text: You had sex, didn't you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How do you do that?

dialogue.speaker: FRANNIE
dialogue.text: Oh, I hate you, I'm pushing my Aunt Roz through Parrot Jungle and you're having sex! So? Who?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know Paul?

dialogue.speaker: FRANNIE
dialogue.text: Paul the Wine Guy? Oh yeah, I know Paul.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You mean you know Paul like I know Paul?

dialogue.speaker: FRANNIE
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? I take credit for Paul. Y'know before me, there was no snap in his turtle for two years.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Iridium, Monica is working as Frannie enters.]

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (sitting on the arm of the couch)Of course it was a line!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why?! Why? Why, why would anybody do something like that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I assume we're looking for an answer more sophisticated than 'to get you into bed'.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I hate men! I hate men!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no, don't hate, you don't want to put that out into the universe.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Is it me? Is it like I have some sort of beacon that only dogs and men with severe emotional problems can hear?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, c'mere, gimme your feet. (She starts massaging them.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I just thought he was nice, y'know?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (bursts out laughing again) I can't believe you didn't know it was a line!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Guess what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You got a job?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Are you kidding? I'm trained for nothing! I was laughed out of twelve interviews today.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And yet you're surprisingly upbeat.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You would be too if you found John and David boots on sale, fifty percent off!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, how well you know me...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: They're my new 'I don't need a job, I don't need my parents, I've got great boots' boots!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How'd you pay for them?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, credit card.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And who pays for that?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um... my... father.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.]

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is sitting around the kitchen table. Â 
Rachel's credit cards are spread out on the table along with a pair of scissors.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, come on you guys, is this really necessary? I mean, I can stop charging anytime I want.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: C'mon, you can't live off your parents your whole life.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know that. That's why I was getting married.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Give her a break, it's hard being on your own for the first time.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You're welcome. I remember when I first came to this city. I was fourteen. My mom had just killed herself and my step-dad was back in prison, and I got here, and I didn't know anybody. And I ended up living with this albino guy who was, like, cleaning windshields outside port authority, and then he killed himself, and then I found aromatherapy. So believe me, I know exactly how you feel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The word you're looking for is 'Anyway'...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, you ready?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. No, no, I'm not ready! How can I be ready? "Hey, Rach! You ready to jump out the airplane without your parachute?" Come on, I can't do this!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You can, I know you can!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't think so.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Come on, you made coffee! You can do anything! (Chandler slowly tries to hide the now dead plant from that morning when he and Joey poured their coffee into it.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: C'mon, cut. Cut, cut, cut,...

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut... (She cuts one of them and they cheer.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Y'know what? I think we can just leave it at that. It's kinda like a symbolic gesture...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel! That was a library card!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut, cut..

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (as Rachel is cutting up her cards) Y'know, if you listen closely, you can hear a thousand retailers scream.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Welcome to the real world! It sucks. You're gonna love it!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, that's it (To Ross) You gonna crash on the couch?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No. No, I gotta go home sometime.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You be okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey Mon, look what I just found on the floor. (Monica smiles.) What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's Paul's watch. You just put it back where you found it. Oh boy. Alright. Goodnight, everybody.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Goodnight.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mmm. (They both reach for the last cookie) Oh, no-

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sorry-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No no no, go-

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, you have it, really, I don't want it-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Split it?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. (They split it.) You know you probably didn't know this, but back in high school, I had a, um, major crush on you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I knew.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You did! Oh.... I always figured you just thought I was Monica's geeky older brother.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I did.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh. Listen, do you think- and try not to let my intense vulnerability become any kind of a factor here- but do you think it would be okay if I asked you out? Sometime? Maybe?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, maybe...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay... okay, maybe I will...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Goodnight.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Goodnight.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: See ya.... Waitwait, what's with you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I just grabbed a spoon. (Ross exits and Monica has no idea what that means.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is sitting around the kitchen table. Â 
Rachel's credit cards are spread out on the table along with a pair of scissors.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I can't believe what I'm hearing here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (sings) I can't believe what I'm hearing here...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What? I-I said you had a-

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (sings) What I said you had...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Would you stop?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, was I doing it again?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yes!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I said that you had a nice butt, it's just not a great butt.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, you wouldn't know a great butt if it came up and bit ya.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: There's an image.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (walks up with a pot of coffee) Would anybody like more coffee?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Did you make it, or are you just serving it?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm just serving it.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah, I'll have a cup of coffee.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Kids, new dream... I'm in Las Vegas. (Rachel sits down to hear Chandler's dream.)

dialogue.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogue.text: (To Rachel) Ahh, miss? More coffee?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ugh. (To another customer that's leaving.) Excuse me, could you give this to that guy over there? (Hands him the coffee pot.) Go ahead. (He does so.) Thank you. (To the gang.) Sorry. Okay, Las Vegas.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, so, I'm in Las Vegas... I'm Liza Minelli-
